statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Given a permutation a1, a2, … aN of {1, 2, …, N}, we define its E-value as the amount of elements where ai > i. For example, the E-value of permutation {1, 3, 2, 4} is 1, while the E-value of {4, 3, 2, 1} is 2. You are requested to find how many permutations of {1, 2, …, N} whose E-value is exactly k.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There are several test cases, and one line for each case, which contains two integers, N and k. (1 <= N <= 1000, 0 <= k <= N).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Output one line for each case. For the answer may be quite huge, you need to output the answer module 1,000,000,007.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
1
4


Hint
There is only one permutation with E-value 0: {1,2,3}, and there are four permutations with E-value 1: {1,3,2}, {2,1,3}, {3,1,2}, {3,2,1}
